title.rendered: Everything You Need to Know About Lip Tattoos or Blushing: What Is It, Benefits, How It’s Done, and More!

content.rendered:
If you want to enhance the colour and shape of your lips, lip blushing may be a good option. This semi-permanent tattoo deposits colour ink into your lips and along your lip line to improve their overall appearance. The results are subtle and look very natural. This article covers everything you need to know about lip blushing, including its benefits, how it’s done, who is a good candidate, and more!

What Is Lip Blushing?

Lip tattoos, also called lip blushing or lip tinting, is a semi-permanent tattooing procedure that improves the colour and shape of your lips. It’s done by depositing colour ink into your lips and along your lip line. The results are usually very natural looking. Lip tattoos can last for several years before they start to fade. In the meantime, you’ll enjoy having fuller, more defined lips.

What Are the Benefits of Lip Blushing?

Lip blushing can provide many benefits, including:

  • Enhancing the natural colour of your lips.

  • Giving the appearance of fuller lips.

  • Defining the lip line.

  • Correcting asymmetry.

  • Making the lips appear more uniform in colour.

How is Lip Blushing Done?


Lip blushing is usually done in a single session that lasts about an hour. During your lip blushing appointment, our team of expert aestheticians will work with you to choose the perfect shade of lip blush. Once the colour is selected, we will numb your lips and apply a lip liner to help guide the tattooing process.

Once your lips are numb, the technician will use a small needle to deposit the ink into your lips and along your lip line. The entire process usually takes about an hour to complete.

After the procedure is complete, you may experience some swelling and tenderness for a few days.

Lip Blushing Before and After

Here at Blink Beauty Salons, we’re proud to offer lip-blushing services to help our clients achieve the perfect pout. Check out some of our before and after photos to see the amazing results of this semi-permanent tattooing treatment.

Before & After photos

After

If you’re interested in lip blushing or any of our other aesthetic services, we invite you to schedule a consultation at our clinic. We’ll work with you to create a personalized treatment plan that meets your unique needs and goals. Contact us today to get started!

Lip blushing is a popular semi-permanent tattooing treatment that can enhance the colour and shape of your lips, giving you the perfect pout.

How Do You Choose the Right Blush for Your Skin Tone?

It’s no secret that a good blush can really brighten up your face and give you a healthy-looking glow. If you’re fair-skinned, you might find some blushes that look too intense or unnatural on your skin. Or, if you have olive skin, you might find that some blushes can make you look a bit washed out. 

We’ve got you covered whether you’re fair, medium, or olive-skinned. Keep reading to find out more. 

Best Blush for Fair Skin Tones 

If you have fair skin, you might want to avoid overly pigmented blushes as they can sometimes look too harsh. Instead, opt for a baby pink, peach, or plum shade. These colours will add a touch of colour to your cheeks without looking too overdone. 

Best Blush for Medium Skin Tones 

You’re lucky if you have medium skin, as most blushes should suit your skin tone nicely. Apricot and berry shades are particularly flattering on medium skin tones. These colours will give your cheeks a lovely flush of colour without looking too artificial. 

Best Blush for Olive Skin Tones 

If you have olive skin, chances are you have a warm undertone. This means that cool-toned blushes can sometimes make you look a bit washed out. Instead, opt for warm peach, bronze, copper, or rose shades of blush. These colours will complement your olive skin nicely and give you a healthy-looking glow. 

Regardless of your skin tone, there’s definitely a blush out there that’s perfect for you. If you’re unsure which colour is right for you, our team of expert aestheticians can help. We’ll work with you to find the perfect shade of lip blushing to enhance your unique features.

The Best Ways to Care For Your Lip Blush

To ensure the best results, it’s essential to care for your lip blush properly. For the first 24 hours after treatment, avoid wearing lipstick or any other makeup on your lips. This will give the ink time to set and prevent any smudging.

It’s also important to avoid picking or scratching at your lips, as this can cause the ink to fade prematurely. And be sure to keep your lips hydrated by drinking plenty of water and using a lip balm with SPF during the day.

These simple tips will help you enjoy long-lasting results from your lip blush treatment.

Lip Blushing vs. Permanent Lip Color

Lip blushing and permanent lip colour are two popular options for those looking to enhance their lips. So, what’s the difference between the two?

Permanent lip colour is just that – permanent. The colour is implanted into the lips using a needle and can last for years. This option is ideal for those who want long-lasting results with little upkeep. However, it’s important to note that permanent lip colour can be difficult to correct if you’re not happy with the results.

Lip blushing, on the other hand, is a semi-permanent tattoo that can last for one to three years. The results are more subtle than permanent lip colour, giving you a natural look. And if you’re not happy with the results, lip blushing is much easier to correct.

So, which option is right for you? If you want a long-lasting solution with little upkeep, permanent lip colour may be the way to go. But if you’re looking for a more subtle enhancement that can be easily corrected, lip blushing may be your best bet.

If you’re still undecided, we recommend scheduling a consultation with our team of expert aestheticians at Blink Beauty Salons. We’ll help you choose the right option for your unique needs and goals. Contact us today to get started!

FAQs on Lip Blushing

How Much Does Lip Blushing Cost?

Lip blushing typically costs between R3 000 and R4 000 per session. The exact cost will depend on the technician performing the procedure, the geographic location, and other factors.

Is lip bushing a permanent makeup procedure?

A is a semi-permanent tattoo that can enhance the colour and shape of your lips and give the impression of more fullness. This is done by depositing colour ink into your lips and along your lip line to improve the overall look. The colour is subtle to give natural-looking results. Lip blushing typically lasts one to two years before it begins to fade, though touch-ups may be needed sooner if you have particularly oily skin or sun exposure.

Who is a good candidate for lip blushing?

It is a good option for people who want to enhance the appearance of their lips but don’t want the commitment of traditional tattoos. The best candidates for lip blushing are:

  • People with pale or unevenly pigmented lips

  • People who want to improve the symmetry of their lips

  • People who have lost definition in their lip line due to ageing

  • People who are looking for a natural-looking enhancement

What are the risks?

Lip blushing is a relatively safe procedure, but there are some risks involved, including:

  • Allergic reaction to the ink or numbing agent

  • Infection

  • Swelling and bruising

  • Scarring

  • Changes in skin sensation

  • Color changes

How permanent is lip blushing?

Lip blushing is a semi-permanent tattoo that will last for several years but eventually fade over time. The exact length of time it lasts depends on a number of factors, such as the type and quality of ink used, how many times you touch or rub your lips, and how much exposure to sunlight or other sources of ultraviolet (UV) light you get.

One of the benefits of lip blushing is that it gives you the ability to experiment with different colours and shades without having to commit to one for life. If you decide you don’t like the colour or want to try something new, you can simply let it fade away and start fresh with a new shade.

Is lip blushing safe?

Lip blushing is a relatively safe procedure when performed by a licensed and experienced professional. Complications are rare but can include infection, allergic reactions, and scarring.

As with any tattooing procedure, there is always a risk of contracting hepatitis or other blood-borne diseases if reusable needles are not used or if proper sterilization procedures are not followed.

There have also been reports of lip blushing inks causing granulomas (clusters of inflammatory cells) to form around the tattooed area.

Does lip blushing hurt?

Lip blushing does not generally hurt, as the needles are fine. You may feel slightly prickling during the lip blushing procedure, but this should not be painful. If you have sensitive skin, you may want to ask your clinician to numbing cream before starting the lip blushing treatment.

What is the recovery time for lip blushing?

There is no downtime required after lip blushing, and you should be able to resume your normal activities immediately after the procedure. However, it’s important to avoid wearing lipstick or makeup on your lips for at least 24 hours after treatment. This will give the pigment time to set and prevent any smudging.

Are there any side effects of lip blushing?

The most common side effect of lip blushing is temporary swelling and redness. This usually subsides within a few hours after the procedure. Other rare side effects can include infection, allergic reaction, and scarring.

Can I brush my teeth after lip blushing?

Yes, you can brush your teeth after lip blushing. In fact, it’s important to keep your lips clean and hydrated after treatment. Be sure to use a gentle lip balm or cream if your lips feel dry or irritated.

When will I see results from my lip blush?

You should see immediate results from your lip blush treatment. However, the colour may appear slightly darker than what was intended due to swelling. This will subside within a few hours, and the true colour of your lip blush will be revealed. The full healing process for lipblush is 8 weeks from your initial treatment. It is important to follow the aftercare instructions provided for the best results.

Does lip blushing make your lips bigger?

Lip blushing can give the appearance of fuller lips, but it does not actually make your lips bigger. The tattooing process deposits colour ink into your lips and along your lip line to improve the overall look. The colour is subtle to give natural-looking results.

Conclusion

Lip blushing is a popular semi-permanent tattooing treatment that can enhance the colour and shape of your lips, giving you the perfect pout. If you’re interested in lip blushing, be sure to contact Blink Beauty Salon to schedule a consultation. Our expert aestheticians will work with you to create a personalized treatment plan that meets your unique needs and goals. Contact us today to get started!
